intro: Liparis pusilla, commonly known as the small orchid, is a diminutive flowering plant belonging to the orchid family, Orchidaceae. It is native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that often display a range of colors, including white, yellow, and green. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and rocky crevices. Its leaves are grass-like and linear, and it produces a single spike of tiny, clustered flowers. Liparis pusilla is an herbaceous perennial that thrives in cool, humid climates and is often found in association with other shade-tolerant flora.
